text: Spent the last couple days working on an in-depth weekend story on the flooding along the Missouri River. I don't think any other news could possibly overshadow it.
author: andymarso

text: Wade's midrange game would have really helped against the zone defense today, which totally befuddled them
author: andymarso

text: The metro
author: andymarso

text: Interesting. Congrats man and stay in touch
author: andymarso

text: So true and they really missed his midrange game against that zone today. Sucks he wasn’t out there. Tournament time is fickle.
author: andymarso

text: I’m a KU fan but I liked this K-State team. Talented group that stuck together and got better year after year. Sad to see them go out early.
author: andymarso

text: What's next for you?
author: andymarso

text: Inbox: free car seat safety checkups tomorrow from 9 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. at McCarthy Chevrolet (inside the Service Department), 675 North Rawhide, Olathe, KS.
author: andymarso

text: Inbox: Alzheimer’s Association finds Alzheimer’s is projected to increase by 14.8% in Kansas, with more than 62,000 people projected to have the disease by 2025. These findings "further highlight the need to find a way to cure, slow, or prevent this devastating illness."
author: andymarso

text: "It was the best of times, it was the worst of times" :)
author: andymarso

text: This was basically my Facebook news feed like 5-10 years ago. Now most of my friends kids are more grown.
author: andymarso

text: It's a weird time in history.
author: andymarso

text: Inbox: James Koelbl named vice provost for oral health initiatives @Kcumb . Top priority will be studying feasibility of establishing a dental school at KCU's Joplin campus. @UMKansasCity and AT Still U in Kirksville have dental schools in MO, but KS has none.
author: andymarso

text: Yesterday we reported that most people in these communities had already left. Hopefully the rest are getting out safely. Sounds like the levees have held, but water is coming over them. https://www.kansascity.com/news/state/missouri/article228173359.html … #Flood2019 #Flood
author: andymarso

text: There’s no outrage in that tweet just information. I’m legit trying to explain to people that a lot of suffering can result from exposure to chicken pox and for most people it’s entirely unnecessary. As a Christian, I like to help people not suffer.
author: andymarso

text: I was born in the 80s too and would much rather have not had chicken pox. Vaccines work. Pox parties are unnecessary suffering.
author: andymarso

text: Irony. I wish him a speedy recovery.
author: andymarso

text: When you do this you not only expose your kids to risk of complications from chicken pox (including infections of the skin, lungs or brain), you also expose them, decades later, to shingles, which from what I've heard is excruciatingly painful.
author: andymarso

text: I deleted last tweet about expansion passing. The amendment to adopt medicaid expansion has passed but now there will probably be debate on further amendments to the expansion bill. Again, my apologies. #ksleg
author: andymarso

text: I love Minsky's and I love Joe's, but... maybe some things are better off separate.
author: andymarso

text: If #ksleg wanted to get rid of the gut-and-go, it could have voted to get rid of the gut-and-go.
author: andymarso

text: The Kansas House has voted to force a debate on Medicaid expansion, over objection of GOP leaders. #ksleg
author: andymarso

text: Town near Atchison ‘self-evacuating’ as floods cut power and close roads to the north https://www.kansascity.com/news/state/missouri/article228173359.html … #ksleg #moleg

text: #ksleg
author: andymarso

text: Inbox: @Kcumb research symposium today. Research topics include Yoga training in psychiatry, increasing HPV vax rates, cannabis for chronic pain & osteopathic tx for atypical migraine. Alum Dr. McGuirk, director of blood/marrow transplant @KUHospital to give keynote on CAR-T.
author: andymarso

text: Inbox: @UMKansasCity gets $150K grant from Mo. Board of Nursing for "Scholarships for 7 grad students toward completion of their MSN, DNP  or PhD with commitment to teach in nursing for at least 3 years & instructional technology to enhance student learning." 1 of 6 grants
author: andymarso

text: Congrats, Missouri and Kansas. None of your cities made Wallethub's list of top 20 fattest cities in America.
author: andymarso

text: Make sure you tell her that only works when paired with essential oils
author: andymarso

text: Inbox: Robert Wood Johnson Foundation is out with 2019 county health rankings. Familiar story in Kansas: JoCo is at top, WyCo near bottom but several SE KS counties also struggle. In Mo., Platte and Clay near the top, Jackson in the middle.  #ksleg #moleg
author: andymarso

text: Lent is 40 days. Jesus doesn't want you to do this.

text: If Bradley isn’t paying your salary it’s not your job to promote its brand. That seems pretty self evident.

text: I've got a Saturday shift today. Non-health care stories. Man shot outside Prospect Avenue auto shop while getting car repaired dies

text: "Unless a leader is actually teaching you something you didn’t know or  expanding your worldview and moral outlook, you are being used."
